results.title: Children's value judgements (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and David Seligman
results.brief_description: Explains the four basic categories (intuitive, heteronomous, expedient, and altruistic) into which the cognitive styles used in making moral judgements are divided. Children are interviewed and their responses are labelled with one of these categories. Includes discussion of the implications of the postulated categories. A second level course in Educational Studies introduced by Norman Williams.

results.title: Children's Theatre
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Frank Bagnall, John Morris and Lilias Fraser
results.brief_description: Children at the Studio Theatre in Adelaide study painting, music and speech as part of their training in ballet. This is a Children’s Theatre for children and by children. Classes and rehearsals, planning and teaching precede the performance of an Australian ballet, telling the story of an Australian aboriginal legend.

results.title: Children's tapes
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: Children’s Tapes is a classic early video work, a seminal investigation that translates the aesthetics of minimalism, performance, perception and real time into the vernacular of the everyday. With ingenuity and wit, Fox constructs phenomenological dramas from the science of the quotidian. Suspense and surprise suffuse a series of anecdotal episodes that demonstrate basic physical phenomena. Fox builds dramatic tension and mystery with an extreme economy of means, focusing a stationary black-and-white camera on ordinary household objects. With the camera close to his still-life subjects, Fox constructs a series of elementary experiments that illustrate fundamental principles of physical science: A piece of fruit is placed under a tin lid held up by a single match, as an unsuspecting fly approaches the bait; a spoon, balanced on a fork, holds a piece of ice until the melting water topples it; a candle in a pan of water is extinguished when a pot is placed over it. The intimate scale, magnified view, and suspenseful unfolding of minute events in real time all serve to intensify the viewers’ perceptions and expectations in these engaging mini-narratives.

results.title: Children's Story Telling Caravan Bus
results.creator_credit: Hakuho Foundation for the Advancement of Children's Education
results.brief_description: One of the major activities of the Hakuho Foundation is the Children’s Storytelling Caravan Bus. The Caravan Bus travels to places where children gather, to provide a collection of books to children who are beginning to read. Co-operation exists among the caravan bus staff, made up of the storytellers, the rhythm game leaders, the artists who create the pictures and music and writers who provide the stories and rading matter. Special emphasis is also placed on travelling to those areas where the mothers do not recognise the importance of reading to children and thus not only providing enjoyment to the children but also influencing the mothers through these children. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Children's songs of Japan
results.creator_credit: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Sotoji Kimura
results.brief_description: Children are much the same the whole world over - but the songs sung by the children of Japan are traditional and distinctive. Many are associated with the seasons and historical events while others are the simple type of songs associated with childhood adventures and fairy tale characters, but all have a truly Japanese character.

results.title: Children's song games = Comptines
results.brief_description: Springtime means being outside. It means being able to play hopscotch, and sing songs, and play with bolo-bats. This film is about little girls celebrating spring in Montreal. They play in alley-ways, in doorways, in parks, and on the street. They sing songs that were sung by their parents and maybe their grandparents. Gibberish rhymes, counting songs, and old folk songs ring out in children’s voices. Without commentary, this short sketch travels the by-ways of Montreal where little girls play. Comptines is a French word for children’s song games.

results.title: Children's play centres
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and National Fitness Council of Victoria
results.brief_description: During the Christmas holidays many Melbourne children are entertained and cared for at play centres, established by local authorities in association with the National Fitness Council. Short sequences show the youngsters taking part in various games under the guidance of trained leaders.

results.title: Children's language in early reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and Edward Milner
results.brief_description: Samples some of the early reading activities in two primary schools in Britain. These activities include use of word cards, sentence construction and reading of printed texts and children’s own stories.

results.title: Children's fantasies
results.brief_description: To children all fantasies, useful or destructive, are very real. This film explains some of the causes of children’s fantasies and shows how they may affect a child’s development. It discusses such common problems as fear of the dark, imaginary friends, and the interpretation of Santa Claus. Suggests ways of making fantasies an impetus to creative living rather than an escape from reality.

results.title: Children's aggression: its origin and control (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the basis for normal aggression in young children, and presents methods for effectively managing this behaviour. Laboratory demonstrations and filmed examples of children’s aggression illustrate its types and causes
